com.edugility.objexj.engine
Class InstructionContext<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.edugility.objexj.engine.InstructionContext<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of object returned by the read() method
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class InstructionContext<T>
extends Object
implements Serializable

A context inside of which an Instruction is executed.

Structurally speaking, an InstructionContext is a façade around a Thread, exposing only those methods that are needed by Instructions.

Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
Thread, Serialized Form

Method Detail

getVariables

public Map<Object,Object> getVariables()
Returns this InstructionContext's associated Map of variables.

This method may return null.

The Map this method returns is returned by reference, so modifications made to it will be visible to consumers of the return value of subsequent invocations of this method. Subclasses must preserve these semantics if they override this method.

Returns:
a Map of variables; may be null
See Also:
Thread.getVariables()

scheduleNewThread

public final boolean scheduleNewThread(int programCounterIndex,
                                       boolean relative)
Creates a new Thread and schedules it for execution beginning at the supplied programCounterIndex.

The supplied programCounterIndex may be an absolute or relative index—this is governed by the relative parameter.

Parameters:
programCounterIndex - where in the new Thread's Program execution should begin
relative - whether the programCounterIndex is an absolute index or an index relative to this InstructionContext's current Program's index
Returns:
true if a new Thread was actually scheduled; false otherwise
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the programCounterIndex was invalid
See Also:
Thread.newThread(Object, int, boolean), Thread.schedule(Thread)

jump

public final boolean jump(int programCounter,
                          boolean relative)
Advances this InstructionContext to the supplied programCounter location.

Parameters:
programCounter - a representation of the new program counter
relative - whether programCounter is to be interpreted relative to its current notional location or as an absolute index
Returns:
true if the supplied programCounter and relative parameters taken together represent a valid location and the underlying Thread remains viable; false otherwise
See Also:
Thread.jump(int, boolean)

save

public final void save(Object key)
Saves the current value of the item pointer so that ultimately a capture group may be recorded.

Parameters:
key - the key under which the group should be saved; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if key is null
IllegalStateException - if die() has been previously called (if the underlying Thread is not viable)
See Also:
Thread.save(Object), Thread.getSubmatches()

stop

public final void stop(Object key)
Completes capturing a portion of the input starting with the previously saved item pointer location and ending with the exclusive current item pointer location.

Parameters:
key - the key identifying the starting item pointer location; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if key is null
IllegalStateException - if die() has been previously called (if the underlying Thread is not viable)
See Also:
Thread.stop(Object), Thread.getSubmatches()

atStart

public final boolean atStart()
Returns true if the next call to read() will read the first item in the input.

As an edge case, if the input is null or empty, this method will return true.

Returns:
true if the next call to read() will read from the beginning; false otherwise
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the underlying Thread has a state that is Thread.State.DEAD
See Also:
Thread.atStart()

atEnd

public final boolean atEnd()
Returns true if the last call to read() read the last item in the input.

Returns:
true if the last call to read() read the last item in the input; false otherwise
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the underlying Thread has a state that is Thread.State.DEAD
See Also:
Thread.atEnd()

advanceProgramCounter

public final boolean advanceProgramCounter()
Advances the associated program counter by one instruction. Returns true if advancement was possible, or false if it was not and if the underlying Thread is no longer viable.

Returns:
true if advancement succeeded; false otherwise
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the underlying Thread has a state that is Thread.State.DEAD
See Also:
Thread.advanceProgramCounter()

advanceItemPointer

public final boolean advanceItemPointer()
Advances the associated item pointer forward by one item.

Returns:
true if advancement succeeded and the resulting item pointer is valid; false otherwise
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the underlying Thread has a state that is Thread.State.DEAD
See Also:
Thread.advanceItemPointer()

canRead

public final boolean canRead()
Returns true if this InstructionContext can read an item in the input.

Returns:
true if this InstructionContext can read; false otherwise
See Also:
Thread.canRead()

read

public final T read()
Reads the current item in the input and returns it. Subsequent invocations of this method will return the same Object.

This method may return null.

Returns:
the current item in the input; may be null
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this InstructionContext cannot read
See Also:
Thread.read()

die

public final void die()
Causes this InstructionContext to become invalid.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - if match() was previously called
See Also:
Thread.die()

match

public final void match()
Records the fact that a match has occurred.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - if die() was previously called
See Also:
Thread.match()
